channel.title: Diablo II Ice Orb Sorceress Guide
channel.description:
Leveling. Leveling is really hard at low levels because of 2 things for me. 1) You have low life, so if you run out of mana, you can't really kill anything without being killed 1-2 times. 2) You run out of stamina quick, so you'll end up having to walk around while your stamina is regenerating, and it gets so boring that some people just quit until the next day, but they repeat this and eventually just delete their sorceress, and I don't want that to happen to everyone, so heres my small guide ;)
Level 1-3, you can easily get to level 3 by killing the monsters in, and on the way, to the Den of Evil. Level 3-5, you can get from doing the Blood Raven Quest. Level 5-10, you can get from killing monsters in the Stony Field and the Dark Wood. Level 7-8-14, do Tristram Runs. Level 14-20, do Canyon of the Maji/Tomb runs. Level 20-24(25), do Cow runs. Level 24(25)-25(26), do Ancients. Level 25(26)-40(45), do Baal runs. Level 50-55(60), You can stop at either 55 or 60, but do Nightmare cows. Level 60-75(80), Nightmare Baal runs or Hell Chaos Sanctuary runs. Level 80-99, Hell Baal runs.
Here's the 3 most important skills you need to become an ice orb sorc. Maxed Ice Orb Maxed Ice Bolt Maxed Cold Mastery, and 1 point into all prequisites.
Here's a few optional skills. Teleport (easy to get around) Static Field (lowers enemy hp, good for team games and bosses) Lightning / Chain Lightning / Fire ball (For immune to cold monsters)
You should try to get atleast 1 Ring of Jordan, since it gives the +1 to all skills, or any other ring / amulet that gives +1/+2 to all skills, my amulet gives +3 to all cold skills and +100 to life.
Use mercs as a tank if you can afford to get them fortitude, crown of thieves, and infinity. If you can't afford anything good to put on your merc, then don't try to get one, it'll turn out to be a waste of money.
In Hell Baal games, barbs and paladins are your best friends. If a paladin is using hammers, get inside the hammers circle and use your spells. If a paladin is using bo's, be sure to get them, and use him as a tank and help him by freezing / killing enemies.

item.title: Diablo II Ice Orb Sorceress Guide
item.dc:creator: @ninjasod ninjasod
item.description:
@ninjasod wrote:

1337h4x:

Does anyone still play Diablo2? I actually think my compy can run it. I should try it out, do they have torrents/serials/cracks for it?

Yeah, but there’s 2 things wrong with that.

  1. If you keep using cracks and serials that don’t work, you get banned.
  2. There’s ways to play without a disc, but I haven’t found any that work.
    If you have a disc, but not the box with the key, then go back to #1 =
    If you have the disc and the box, what’s the point of using a crack >.<

Read full topic

item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“ninjasod, post:10, topic:102552”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=146947.msg1463717#msg1463717 date=1181518256]
my mf sorc was such fun. well past the 60 day limit by now.
[/quote]
Actually its a 90 day limit for permed characters, and 10 day for unperm

Hdins = best mf characters…gotta love them!

I kindve agree with you there, since like nothing is immune to them, but uber smiters/zealers can get you more hrs with the torches[/quote]

Yup loved my hdin,was godly,lvl 92 only though

item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

ninjasod:

If you wait until 28-30 to do Baal runs, you’re pretty stupid. Baal runs give way more exp than cows after level 24, so you should do Ancients at 24 and then you can do Baal at 25, then from there just get rushes and do ancients and baal and etc.

Just like I said

item.dc:creator: @ninjasod ninjasod
item.description:
@ninjasod wrote:

Leveling.
Leveling is really hard at low levels because of 2 things for me.

  1. You have low life, so if you run out of mana, you can’t really kill anything without being killed 1-2 times.
  2. You run out of stamina quick, so you’ll end up having to walk around while your stamina is regenerating, and it gets so boring that some people just quit until the next day, but they repeat this and eventually just delete their sorceress, and I don’t want that to happen to everyone, so heres my small guide

Level 1-3, you can easily get to level 3 by killing the monsters in, and on the way, to the Den of Evil.
Level 3-5, you can get from doing the Blood Raven Quest.
Level 5-10, you can get from killing monsters in the Stony Field and the Dark Wood.
Level 7-8-14, do Tristram Runs.
Level 14-20, do Canyon of the Maji/Tomb runs.
Level 20-24(25), do Cow runs.
Level 24(25)-25(26), do Ancients.
Level 25(26)-40(45), do Baal runs.
Level 50-55(60), You can stop at either 55 or 60, but do Nightmare cows.
Level 60-75(80), Nightmare Baal runs or Hell Chaos Sanctuary runs.
Level 80-99, Hell Baal runs.

Here’s the 3 most important skills you need to become an ice orb sorc.
Maxed Ice Orb
Maxed Ice Bolt
Maxed Cold Mastery, and 1 point into all prequisites.

Here’s a few optional skills.
Teleport (easy to get around)
Static Field (lowers enemy hp, good for team games and bosses)
Lightning / Chain Lightning / Fire ball (For immune to cold monsters)

You should try to get atleast 1 Ring of Jordan, since it gives the +1 to all skills, or any other ring / amulet that gives +1/+2 to all skills, my amulet gives +3 to all cold skills and +100 to life.

Use mercs as a tank if you can afford to get them fortitude, crown of thieves, and infinity. If you can’t afford anything good to put on your merc, then don’t try to get one, it’ll turn out to be a waste of money.
